text: Hey everyone, thought I post this quite basic question here, as I'm new to HubSpot website building. A problem I've encountered quite a lot is the inability to apply classes and id's to elements from within the page builder.  If there's a certain type of section on every page that I want to target with css, I have to target their unique class / id separately. Is there a way to add classes and id's as fields in the page builder or otherwise approach this problem in a better way?
'.btn-cta a' isn't a class, its a selector.  I would try inputing the classes without the . at the front and omit the .btn-cta a' one.

I have the same question?

 I always overwrite this with classes or !important, but if I could know where it come from I could handle it in a cleaner way.

<@U2H3TT8F2> <@U7SL518D6>can you help?

The only thing I can spot immediately is that your first color field is missing a `label` property. I’ve never tried not including one, so I’m not certain if labels are required, but it’s probably worth a shot as a first troubleshooting step.
